metadata.title: Week 1 Day 1: Introduction to Latin Basics

prior_knowledge_digest: Students should have a basic understanding of language learning principles, such as recognizing patterns, memorizing vocabulary, and understanding sentence structure. Familiarity with English grammar will be beneficial, as many concepts in Latin are similar, such as nouns, verbs, and adjectives. Students should also be prepared to engage with a new alphabet and pronunciation system, as Latin pronunciation differs from English.
yesterday_recap: N/A - This is the first lesson of the course.
misconception_watchlist: Expecting Latin word order to match English

primary: Introduce students to the Latin alphabet and pronunciation
Familiarize students with basic Latin greetings
Explain the concept of noun cases

lesson_flow.description: Welcome students and introduce the course.
lesson_flow.student_action: Listen and respond to the teacher's greeting.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Set a positive tone for the course.

lesson_flow.description: Introduce the Latin alphabet and pronunciation.
lesson_flow.student_action: Repeat after the teacher and practice pronunciation.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Use audio clips to demonstrate correct pronunciation.

lesson_flow.student_action: Pair up and practice greetings with a partner.

lesson_flow.description: Explain the concept of noun cases in Latin.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Use examples to illustrate how noun cases work.

lesson_flow.description: Review key points and answer any questions.
lesson_flow.student_action: Participate in the review and ask final questions.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Encourage students to reflect on what they learned.

behavior.loop_behavior: Repeat key points if students seem confused
